children.value: Place a group of content in multiple accordion panels, and click the panel's title to expand or collapse its contents.
Control the expanded panel list through

props.code:
<z-collapse v-model="active1">
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 1">
     Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 2">
     The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
     Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 3">
     When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
     Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
     At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
   </z-collapse-item>
</z-collapse>

children.value: Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
Accordion mode can be set through
, and up to one panel can be expanded. At this time,

props.code:
<z-collapse v-model="active2" accordion>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 1">
     Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 2">
     The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
     Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 3">
     When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
     Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
     At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
   </z-collapse-item>
</z-collapse>

The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.

props.code:
<z-collapse v-model="active3">
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 1">
     Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 2" disabled>
     The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
     Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 3" disabled>
     When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
     Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
     At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
   </z-collapse-item>
</z-collapse>

children.value: Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
The content of the title bar can be customized through the

props.code:
<z-collapse v-model="active4">
   <z-collapse-item>
     <template #title> Title 1<z-icon name="tag" /> </template>
     Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 2" value="Content" icon="question-circle">
     The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
     Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
   </z-collapse-item>
</z-collapse>

children.value: Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
Expand all and toggle all can be achieved through the

props.code:
<z-collapse v-model="active5" ref="collapse">
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 1" name="1">
     Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 2" name="2">
     The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
     Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
   </z-collapse-item>
   <z-collapse-item title="Title 3" name="3">
     When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
     Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
     At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
   </z-collapse-item>
</z-collapse>
<view class="demo-collapse-buttons">
   <z-button type="primary" @click="openAll"> Expand all </z-button>
   <z-button
     type="primary"
     :custom-style="{ 'margin-left': '30rpx' }"
     @click="toggleAll"
   >
     Switch all
   </z-button>
</view>

children.value: Zebra-swiper is a mobile carousel component developed based on uniapp.
The zebraSwiper component mainly consists of z-swiper and z-swiper-item.
Among them, the z-swiper-item component can only be placed in the z-swiper component.
When using components, you can pass parameters to the components through props to achieve different configurations.
Typically, configuration will be passed to components through the options object. Therefore, configuration items should be written into options.
At the same time, you can also call component methods through $refs.
Tips: The toggleAll method cannot be used in accordion mode.
The name of the currently expanded panel
Whether to display the outer border
activeNames: The type is consistent with the value bound to v-model
Unique identifier, default is index value
The icon name or image link on the left side of the title bar, which is equivalent to the
Title bar size, optional value is
Content on the left side of the title bar
Content on the right side of the title bar
Whether to display the inner border
Whether to display the arrow on the right side of the title bar and enable click feedback
Whether it is in read-only state. The panel cannot be operated in read-only state
Additional class name for the left title
Additional class name for content on the right
Through ref, you can get the CollapseItem instance and call the instance method.
Toggle the expanded state of all panels, pass
to collapse all, pass no parameters to toggle all
Through ref, you can get the CollapseItem instance and call the instance method.
Switch the panel expansion state, pass
to collapse, pass no parameter to toggle
Customize the title bar on the left sidecapacity
Customize the content on the right side of the title bar
Customize the icon on the left side of the title bar
Customize the icon on the right side of the title bar
The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
